pullRequest.body:
Add four theorems about continuity from below/above of measures. Contrary to those already existing, no assumptions about the sequence of sets. Show that the measures of the partial unions/intersections converge to the measure of the union/intersection.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8998441517/job/24718560842)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8998441517/job/24718561609)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8998441517/job/24718561841)

I am not completely convinced by the added generality here, because I don't imagine we will apply this version of the lemma. On the other hand, I am completely convinced by `tendsto_measure_iUnion'`. What about specializing `measure_iUnion_eq_iSup'` to take a directed order instead of a general relation, to make it easier to parse while not really changing the applicability?

Same thing for the decreasing version below.

I agree the hypotheses are not very natural, a directed preorder is of course enough. I also discovered [Set.Accumulate](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Accumulate.html#Set.Accumulate) which simplifies the proofs involving unions.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: continuity of measure without monotonicity assumptions

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: separable measure and sufficient condition for Lp spaces to be second-countable
